titleStmt.title: An enterlude called lusty Iuuentus Lyuely describing the frailtie of youth: of natur, prone to vyce: by grace and good counsayll, traynable to vertue. The parsonages that speake. Messenger. Lusty Iuuentus. Good counsaill. Knowledge. Sathan the deuyll. Hypocrisie. Felowship. Abhominable lyuing. Gods mercifull promises. Foure maye playe it easely, takyng such partes as they thinke best: so that any one take of those partes that be not in place at once.
Lusty Juventus
titleStmt.author: Wever, R.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Lothbury, ouer agaynst Sainct Margarits Church, by Wyllyam Copland,

notesStmt.note: Printer's name and address from colophon; publication date estimated by STC.
Identified as STC 25147 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
